d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:28): sayotte: use qtextedit
cf8628943701b08648785c3613d91fe2 (05:40): Hi, I got a problem: I have a custom class in which I declare a signal: void insertText(const QString &);
cf8628943701b08648785c3613d91fe2 (05:40): I connect it to a Slot of QTextEdit object:
cf8628943701b08648785c3613d91fe2 (05:40): QObject::connect(this, SIGNAL(insertText(const QString &)),
cf8628943701b08648785c3613d91fe2 (05:40): txtedit, SLOT(insertPlainText(const QString &)));
cf8628943701b08648785c3613d91fe2 (05:41): Somewhere, I need to fire the signal, but I have a QString str;
cf8628943701b08648785c3613d91fe2 (05:41): How do I fire the signal ? Simply give a call to insertText(str)  ????
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:42): although emit is defined as nothing really...
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:42): Akhilesh: so your question is how do you "activate" a signal?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:43): Akhilesh: http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/signalsandslots.html#a-small-example

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:46): Akhilesh: ok, you're using emit. Is there an actual problem happening?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:47): Akhilesh: actually, looking at your code, you're making connections each time you click the start button... you probably don't want that

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:51): use the pastebin instead of spamming the channel with useless error messages :-P
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:52): I already know what the problem is and told you that you need to make sure moc is run on the file
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:52): if you used qmake, it would take care of it for you.

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:53): but I'm not sure what to do with code::blocks other than use that qtworkbench plugin, but apparently that's broken at the moment. Maybe somebody else has more experience there
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:54): but if you just want it to compile right now, open up a dos prompt, cd to your source directory and type "qmake -project [ENTER] qmake [ENTER] mingw32-make"
